0.user_question: Two sisters, Elizabeth and Margareth, bought beads. Elizabeth bought 1 pack of red and 2 packs of clear beads, while Margareth bought 3 packs of blue and 4 packs of red beads. How many more beads do one sister have than the other, if each pack of beads contains 7234498 pieces of beads?

ost_step.1: Calculate the number of beads Elizabeth got: (1+2)*7234498=2*7234498=14468996 beads.
ost_step.2: Calculate the number of beads Margareth got: (3+4)*7234498=7*7234498=50641486 beads.
ost_step.3: Subtract the smaller amount from the larger amount: 50641486 - 14468996 = 36172490.

direct_answer.text: Elizabeth first calculated the sum as follows: (1+2) multiplied by 7234498 equals 2 times 7234498 which results in 14468996 beads. Next, Margareth calculated the same process resulting into: (3+4) multiplied by 7234498 hence getting; 7 times 7234498 thus leading to 50641486 beads altogether. Lastly, subtracting both totals leads us to find out who among them owns most when we say, 'subtraction operation performed between Margareth’s resultant value compared against Elizabeth.’ Therefore concluding this calculation shows me 36172490 extra beads owned or possessed belonging only unto either margarethe or elizabeth depending upon whose possession ends up being greater post substractions made!
